bug.author: Northautumn
bug.summary: AssertionError: No labels found. in running train.py
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. When I train my dataset, I have already labeled it to generate the labels file, but there was a problemï¼š AssertionError: No labels found. in running train.py <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49355997/71343929-2a1eaa00-259c-11ea-8961-d74989a4895d.png></denchmark-link>
why occurs this problemï¼Œand on this projectï¼ŒIT has not weights/last.ptï¼Œhow can i get it? and when I run the train.py, python train.py --data data/rbc.data --cfg cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg it also occurs a bug, Namespace(accumulate=4, adam=False, arc='default', batch_size=16, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg', data='data/rbc.data', device='', epochs=10, evolve=False, img_size=416, img_weights=False, multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, prebias=False, rect=False, resume=False, transfer=False, var=None, weights='weights/ultralytics68.pt') Using CPU Downloading <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1Jm8kqnMdMGUUxGo8zMFZMJ0eaPwLkxSG>https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1Jm8kqnMdMGUUxGo8zMFZMJ0eaPwLkxSG</denchmark-link> as weights/ultralytics68.pt... ç³»ç»Ÿæ‰¾ä¸åˆ°æŒ‡å®šçš„è·¯å¾„ã€‚ 'rm' ä¸æ˜¯å†…éƒ¨æˆ–å¤–éƒ¨å‘½ä»¤ï¼Œä¹Ÿä¸æ˜¯å¯è¿è¡Œçš„ç¨‹åº File "train.py", line 108, in train attempt_download(weights) how can i get the weights,could you help me?thanks very much.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Northautumn>@Northautumn</denchmark-link> you can download the weights directly from the Google Drive folder in your own message. The link is right there.

One approach that finally fixed the Assertion Error for me was to parse the data files and add the absolute path to the images path. So for example replace <denchmark-code>../coco/images/train2017/000000109622.jpg # image ../coco/labels/train2017/000000109622.txt # label </denchmark-code>
with <denchmark-code>/home/user/something/coco/images/train2017/000000109622.jpg # image /home/user/something/coco/labels/train2017/000000109622.txt # label </denchmark-code>
Just to be sure, one can also pass absolute path to the .data file, when pointing to train and validation directory.
I'll close this issue for now as the original issue appears to have been resolved, and/or no activity has been seen for some time. Feel free to comment if this is not the case.
